definition: chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
an overall plan/to plan an entire project as a whole
to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
an overall plan taking into account all factors
lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies

sentences.english: In the industry, these are called "chargebacks."
sentences.chinese: 在衆籌行業中，這就叫做“退單拒付”。

sentences.english: I foresee securities crowdfunding being very successful on the intrastate level.
sentences.chinese: 我預測證券衆籌在州內會非常成功。

sentences.english: Here are eight of the most impressive crowdfunded products at the show.
sentences.chinese: 以下是此次展會中八項最爲耀眼的衆籌產品。

sentences.english: Crowdfunding is poised to usher in a new asset class that will change how early stage financing transactions are consummated.
sentences.chinese: 衆籌建立的新資本類別將會使早期交易業務更加完美。

sentences.english: It would also require crowdfunding platforms to conduct due-diligence on companies raising capital.
sentences.chinese: 這就要求衆籌平臺要盡職調查融資公司。

sentences.english: The provisions were obtained mainly from the war, the land owners, or by purchase or credit on the way.
sentences.chinese: 給養來源主要有戰爭繳獲，打土豪籌糧款和購買借貸。

sentences.english: I had meant to come, but somethellong happened.
sentences.chinese: 我原本籌算來的，但有事發生了。

sentences.english: That leaves Credit Suisse and JPMorgan Chase to take the grand prizes.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士信貸銀行和摩根大通拔頷首籌。

sentences.english: So what type of developer or investor would chase crowdfunded capital from the general public?
sentences.chinese: 那什麼樣的開發商或投資者會選擇衆籌呢？

sentences.english: Many of the most successful companies today have roots in the crowdfunding community.
sentences.chinese: 當今許多很成功的企業都或多或少與衆籌相關。

sentences.english: Sleepless, the number of Pennsylvania for more chips.
That will leave little money for a security build-up.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，佩雷茲幾乎籌不到錢來打造安全部隊力量了。

definition: to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
to arrive at (place or time)/period/to become due/classifier for events, meetings, elections, sporting fixtures, years (of graduation)
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
